This diploma program focuses on environmental systems design, operation, and maintenance in heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration (HVAC/R) for both residential and commercial sectors. Students will gain practical skills through hands-on experience and competency with industry-standard practices as established by HRAI, ASHRAE, and the Canada Green Building Council. The program requires students to complete semester 2 during the summer after enrolling in January to continue into semester 3 in the fall.

Graduates of this program will be prepared for various careers in the HVAC field including technician roles in installation, maintenance, and repair. Additionally, graduates can challenge the Gas Fitter 2 provincial qualification exam and obtain certification if successful (75 per cent passing grade). For semester 3's Building Code for HVAC course, students are assisted in preparing to challenge the Ontario Ministry of Consumer Affairs and Housing HVAC House exam, which can lead to obtaining a "Building Code Identification Number" (BCIN) upon successful completion.

Note: There is further information regarding BCIN available on the Ontario Building Code website.

Career Options:
- Technicians install, maintain, and repair heating, air conditioning, and refrigeration systems for commercial and residential buildings.
- Sales positions in HVAC industry.
- System balancing roles.
- Cost-estimating for projects.
